availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Sylvester W. Raplee (Louisville, Kentucky, merchant, first lieutenant and captain (U.S.A.))

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, merchant and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of Joseph Raplee and Sarah Kellum Raplee. Married to Mattie J. Wilkerson Raplee. Father of Sylvester Mason Raplee. Merchant in Louisville, Kentucky, in 1861. Served in the 4th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry (U.S.A.) as a captain and first lieutenant from November 11, 1861, to February 28, 1863. Produce merchant in partnership with John W. Stockton in Louisville in 1865.

ab.bibl:
